Module kivakit.filesystems.hdfs
Package com.telenav.kivakit.filesystems.hdfs

Class HdfsProxyClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
      • com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Receiver<com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Transmittable>, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter<com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.messaging.Transmittable>, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.language.paths.PackagePathed, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.Transceiver
    public class HdfsProxyClient
extends com.telenav.kivakit.kernel.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
    Not public API

    Launches and communicates with *kivakit-filesystems-hdfs-proxy*. The proxy() method tries to look up the RMI HdfsProxy service provider interface in the RMI registry on the local machine. If the remote interface cannot be found, then launchProxy() is called. This method uses *kivakit-service-client* to allocate a (dynamic) port for the remote object and a port for the data service that uploads and downloads data to and from HDFS. The executable proxy JAR file specified by HdfsSettings is then launched in a *child process* (to avoid versioning issues). The configuration resource folder is also provided by HdfsSettings and must be provided by the user of HdfsFileSystemService.

    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
